name: Rubblebelt Stalker

trait.name: Ambusher
text: In the first round of a combat, the stalker has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn yet.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
text: The stalker can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Ruin Dweller
text: The stalker has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in ruins, and its speed is not reduced in difficult terrain composed of rubble.

trait.name: Siege Monster
text: The stalker deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
text: The stalker makes three attacks with its shortsword.

action.name: Shortsword
text: Melee Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

description:
Rubblebelt stalkers are scouts and skirmishers for the Gruul Clans. They excel at moving over challenging terrain, whether they're picking their way through treacherous ruins or clambering across rooftops. They favor ambush tactics and avoid confrontations with stronger forces, relying on their superior mobility to make their escape.
Source: Guildmasters' Guide to Ravnica p. 239
